dateYYYYMMDD.$comment: If we targeted draft-07 we could use the 'date' format instead of this format pattern. We cannot use the 'date-time' format because our existing values don't validate against it.
dateYYYYMMDD.description: A date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

releaseType.$comment: If we targeted draft-06 we could use oneOf/const in combination to add descriptions to the enum values
releaseType.description: An enumeration describing the different release types of a product

supportPhase.$comment: If we targeted draft-06 we could use oneOf/const in combination to add descriptions to the enum values
supportPhase.description: An enumeration describing the different support phases of a product

channel-version.title: ProductVersion
channel-version.description: The version of the product, e.g '5.0' or '1.1'

eol-date.title: EndOfLifeDate
eol-date.description: The end-of-life (EOL) date for this Product when it is considered to be out of support. The value may be `null` if the EOL date is undetermined, e.g. when a product is still a prerelease.

security.title: LatestReleaseIncludesSecurityUpdate
security.description: `true` if the latest release of this product includes a security update, `false` otherwise.

latest-release-date.title: LatestReleaseDate
latest-release-date.description: The date of the latest release of this product.

latest-release.title: LatestReleaseVersion
latest-release.description: The version of the latest release

latest-runtime.title: LatestRuntimeVersion
latest-runtime.description: The version of the runtime included in the latest release

latest-sdk.title: LatestSdkVersion
latest-sdk.description: The version of the SDK included in the latest release.  This is usually the SDK with the highest feature band. A ProductRelease may include multiple SDKs across different feature bands, all of which carry the same runtime version.

releases.json.$comment: Since this is always an absolute uri, the 'uri' format is unambiguous
releases.json.description: The URL pointing to the releases.json file that contains information about all the releases  associated with this Product.

release-type.description: The type of Product release indicating whether the release is Standard Term Support (sts) or Long Term Support (lts).

support-phase.description: The support phase of the Product.

description: A collection of manifests for .NET products, which is updated with each preview and stable release of the .NET SDK and/or Runtime

releases-index.description: A collection of all released products

title: JSON schema for .NET product collection manifests
